intro: Acrodiclidium misantlae, commonly known as the Misantla cactus, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of Veracruz, Mexico. It is a columnar cactus characterized by its spiny stems and a distinctive crown of leaves at the apex. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring season, which are followed by small, red fruits. Its botanical features include a dense covering of spines and a unique growth form adapted to its arid environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
